titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the photograph album RAF tour on MV Dilwara - compiled by L. Wells - Hisham Khatib Collection AD.MC.030_ref159
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman for Akkasah: Center for Photography at NYUAD

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 19:10:04 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: RAF tour on MV Dilwara - compiled by L. Wells - Hisham Khatib Collection
did.abstract: Photograph album containing 88 prints and 4 cartoons created by officer Les Wells while he served with the RAF Medical Service as part of the "British Forces in Iraq" RAF Command and whilst he was stationed in Abu Qir (Aboukir), Egypt between 1934 and 1939. The album contains photographs of three ships; MV Dilwara (her maiden voyage in March 1936), HT Somersetshire and HMS Enterprise and ports including Karachi and Aden. There are also a number of photographs of the Nouzha Gardens in Alexandria Loose photographs at the end of the album include one of RAF servicemen and women at RAF Hinaidi. See also Iraq, Egypt, Yemen - compiled by L. Wells, part of the Hisham Khatib Collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Dr. Hisham Khatib are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact Akkasah at akkasah@nyu.edu
